intro: Lasthenia chrysostoma, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a cluster of small, pale yellow disk flowers, giving it its common name. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Lasthenia chrysostoma is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom in early spring.
